chapter.title: Abstract Base Classes
chapter.para: Abstract classes are base classes that other classes use for a common set of methods. For instance, the GTKBox abstract class is used by the GTKHBox and GTKVBox classes. The GTKBox class provides a common set of methods used by both of those subclasses.
Abstract classes should NEVER be instantiated on their own. You should always use one of the (non abstract) subclasses that use the abstract class instead.

section.title: GTKBox
section.para: The GTKBox class is a subclass of the GTKContainer class ().
This class provides a common set of methods used by other non abstract classes like the GTKHBox () and the GTKVBox () classes.

section.title: GTKContainer
section.para: The GTKContainer class is a subclass of the GTKWidget class ().
This class provides a common set of methods used by other non abstract classes.

section.title: Method: add
section.para: Add a widget to the container widget.

section.title: Method: remove
section.para: Remove a widget from the container widget.

section.title: Method: set_border_width
section.para: Set the border width for the container.

section.title: Method: signal_connect
section.para: Connect a signal to an ooRexx method.

section.title: Signals and Methods
section.para: This class can receive signals and events. When a signal or event is received a method of the class is invoked. The name of this method corresponds to the name of the signal or event. By default all of the signals have a method predefined in the class to receive the signal. This method performs no actions by default.
In order for the signals to be processed by the user's code you must subclass this class and override the signal method. You can supply any action you wish to process the signal.

By default, none of the signals for this class are connected so even if you provide an override method the method will not be invoked unless the signal is connected first. To connect a signal you must invoke the signal_connect method and provide the name of the signal to be connected.
This class has the following signals available.
